Package com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight

Class PositionalLight

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight.Light
com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight.PositionalLight
All Implemented Interfaces:
Disposable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConeLight, PointLight
public abstract class PositionalLight
extends Light
Abstract base class for all positional lights

Extends Light

  • Constructor Details

    • PositionalLight

      public PositionalLight​(RayHandler rayHandler, int rays, Color color, float distance, float x, float y, float directionDegree)
      Creates new positional light and automatically adds it to the specified RayHandler instance.
      Parameters:
      rayHandler - not null instance of RayHandler
      rays - number of rays - more rays make light to look more realistic but will decrease performance, can't be less than MIN_RAYS
      color - light color
      distance - light distance (if applicable)
      x - horizontal position in world coordinates
      y - vertical position in world coordinates
      directionDegree - direction in degrees (if applicable)

  • Method Details

    • attachToBody

      public void attachToBody​(Body body)
      Description copied from class: Light
      Attaches light to specified body
      Specified by:
      attachToBody in class Light
      Parameters:
      body - that will be automatically followed, note that the body rotation angle is taken into account for the light offset and direction calculations

    • attachToBody

      public void attachToBody​(Body body, float offsetX, float offsetY)
      Attaches light to specified body with relative offset
      Parameters:
      body - that will be automatically followed, note that the body rotation angle is taken into account for the light offset and direction calculations
      offsetX - horizontal relative offset in world coordinates
      offsetY - vertical relative offset in world coordinates

    • attachToBody

      public void attachToBody​(Body body, float offsetX, float offSetY, float degrees)
      Attaches light to specified body with relative offset and direction
      Parameters:
      body - that will be automatically followed, note that the body rotation angle is taken into account for the light offset and direction calculations
      offsetX - horizontal relative offset in world coordinates
      offSetY - vertical relative offset in world coordinates
      degrees - directional relative offset in degrees

    • getPosition

      public Vector2 getPosition()
      Overrides:
      getPosition in class Light
      Returns:
      starting position of light in world coordinates

      NOTE: changing this vector does nothing
